content:
<rule id="embedded-framework-09400" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <or>
                    <file filename="{*}eureka-server{*}.jar"/>
                    <project>
                        <artifact artifactId="{*}eureka-server{*}" groupId="{*}"/>
                    </project>
                </or>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <hint category-id="information" effort="0" title="Embedded framework - Eureka Server">
                    <message>
                        The application embeds the Eureka server. If you are migrating to Azure Spring Apps, Eureka (Standard Tier) or Service Registry (Enterprise Tier) will be hosted for you.
                    </message>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/developer/java/migration/migrate-spring-cloud-to-azure-spring-apps?toc=%2Fazure%2Fspring-apps%2Ftoc.json&bc=%2Fazure%2Fspring-apps%2Fbreadcrumb%2Ftoc.json&pivots=sc-standard-tier#create-an-azure-spring-apps-instance-and-apps" title="Azure Spring Apps - Don't include the Spring Cloud registry"/>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/spring-apps/how-to-service-registration?pivots=programming-language-java" title="Azure Spring Apps - Enable Service Registration"/>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/spring-apps/how-to-access-data-plane-azure-ad-rbac" title="Azure Spring Apps - Access Config Server and Service Registry"/>
                    <link href="http://aka.ms/spring-cloud-to-asa?pivots=sc-standard-tier#remove-restricted-configurations" title="Restricted configurations"/>
                </hint>
                <technology-tag level="INFORMATIONAL">Eureka</technology-tag>
            </perform>
        </rule>
